title: High Vulnerability to Sea Level Rise
description: In 2015, 81.7% of the Marshall Islands' land area was below 5 meters in elevation, making it highly susceptible to rising sea levels.

title: Dominance of Food and Beverage Manufacturing
description: In 2021, food, beverages, and tobacco accounted for 98.1% of the value added in the manufacturing sector, highlighting a significant reliance on this industry.

title: High Incidence of Tuberculosis
description: In 2023, the Marshall Islands reported an incidence rate of 692 cases of tuberculosis per 100,000 people, indicating a major public health challenge.

title: Significant External Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, the Marshall Islands had an external health expenditure of $455.51 per capita, reflecting substantial international financial support for healthcare.

title: Limited Social Insurance Coverage for the Wealthy
description: In 2019, 66.2% of the richest quintile in the Marshall Islands were covered by social insurance programs, indicating room for improvement in social safety nets.

title: Lowest Nitrous Oxide Emissions
description: In 2023, the Marshall Islands recorded a mere 0.0002 Mt CO2e in nitrous oxide emissions, one of the lowest globally.

title: Minimal Central Government Debt
description: As of 2019, the central government debt of the Marshall Islands stood at 96,801,972 LCU, indicating a low debt burden.

title: Low Household Consumption Expenditure
description: In 2023, household consumption expenditure was recorded at 183,222,100 US$, reflecting minimal spending levels.

title: Limited Gross National Expenditure
description: The gross national expenditure in 2023 was 373,102,300 US$, one of the lowest figures globally.

title: Minimal Gross Fixed Capital Formation
description: In 2023, the gross fixed capital formation was 52,381,300 LCU, indicating limited investment in fixed assets.

title: Low Imports of Goods and Services
description: The Marshall Islands imported goods and services worth 184,750,700 LCU in 2023, reflecting a low import level.

title: Minimal Commercial Service Exports
description: In 2021, the value of commercial service exports was 1,059,451.586 US$, one of the lowest globally.

title: Low Female Primary School Dropout
description: Only 15 female primary school children were out of school in 2022, indicating a strong educational retention rate.
